reviewText: This box set contains 3 previously released operas in their original DVD cases, housed in a thin cardboard box. All operas are available on Amazon individually. THE OPERAS ARE: OTELLO (4.8 stars) 2001 Plcido Domingo is Otello. Barbara Frittoli is Desdemona. Leo Nucci is Iago. Riccardo Muti conducts at La Scala. Excellent singing and acting though Domingo's voice is no longer in its prime. Scenery is poorly designed. It is sparse and mostly depressing. There are hardly any props. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Otello And here: Verdi - Otello / Muti, Domingo, Frittoli, Nucci, Ceron, La Scala MACBETH (3.8 stars) 2001 Thomas Hampson is Macbeth. Paoletta Marrocu is Lady Macbeth. Roberto Scandiuzzi is Banco. Franz Welser-Mst conducts the Orchestra of the Zurich Opera House. The singing and acting are excellent, especially by Hampson. Costumes aren't from a single period; some are bizarre. Scenery is sometimes nearly nonexistent, sometimes not connected to the story. There are lots of gimmicky director's choices, such as the witches giving Macbeth a manicure and Duncan having green blood. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Verdi - Macbeth / Welser-Most, Hampson, Marrocu, Zurich Opera FALSTAFF (4.0 stars) 2006 Ruggero Raimondi is Falstaff. Barbara Frittoli is Alice Ford. Mariola Cantarero is Nanetta. Zubin Mehta conducts the Orchestra of the Maggio Musicale Fiorentino. The singing and acting are mostly excellent. The period is updated without gaining anything. The stage space is used well until the final crowded scene. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Verdi - Falstaff BOX SET DUPLICATIONS The production of Otello in this box set is also in the "Riccardo Muti at La Scala" box set. it is here: Riccardo Muti at La Scala 5 DVD Box Set
